title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars in 'The Senior,' portraying Mike Flynt, a college football player who returned to play at age 59.
The film is based on Flynt's true story of redemption and tackles themes of regret and determination.
Chiklis returns to Boston for a pre-release screening and Q&A at AMC Boston Common 19 on September 14.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Nine Massachusetts residents are on Forbes' 2025 list of the 400 richest Americans.
Abigail Johnson is the state's richest person with a net worth of $35 billion, ranking 27th nationwide.
Robert Kraft and Amos Hostetter Jr. are among the Bay Staters listed with net worths of $13.8 billion and $3.9 billion.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox struggle offensively, managing only two hits in 4-1 loss to Yankees at Fenway Park.
Boston's three errors and missed scoring opportunities contribute to defeat against AL East rivals.
Despite solid pitching from Lucas Giolito, Red Sox falter without key players Roman Anthony and Wilyer Abreu.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Deatrich Wise Jr., Washington Commanders defensive end, suffered a season-ending left quad injury against the Packers.
The injury occurred during a blocked extra point attempt; Wise requires surgery and was carted off the field.
Wise, a nine-year NFL veteran, joined the Commanders on a one-year contract after eight years with the Patriots.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early may start Tuesday's game for the Red Sox against the Athletics at Fenway Park.
Early struck out 11 batters in his MLB debut, tying a Red Sox record for most strikeouts in a debut.
Manager Alex Cora is considering lineup options, including young pitchers Payton Tolle and Kyle Harrison.

title: Scott Boras says he, Alex Bregman are ‘waiting until the offseason’ before making opt-out decision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman and agent Scott Boras will decide on his contract opt-out after the Red Sox season ends.
Bregman, under a three-year $120 million contract, can opt out after the 2025 or 2026 season.
Despite injury setbacks, Bregman's leadership has positively impacted Boston's young players during the season.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Misery' starring Kathy Bates is streaming on HBO Max. It's a dark thriller about fandom and obsession.
'This Is Spinal Tap', a classic mockumentary directed by Rob Reiner, is available on Xumo.
'Warfare', a military film co-directed by Ray Mendoza, features Will Poulter and is available on HBO Max.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez, Keion White ruled out vs. Dolphins
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Christian Gonzalez and Keion White are ruled out for the Patriots' game against the Miami Dolphins due to injuries.
Gonzalez has been sidelined since July with a hamstring injury; White played 46% of defensive snaps last week.
Morgan Moses and Marte Mapu are listed as questionable for Sunday's game, while Marcus Bryant may replace Moses if needed.

title: With DC Terrell Williams out, who will be calling defensive plays for Patriots vs. Dolphins?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Zak Kuhr, Patriots' inside linebackers coach, will call defensive plays against the Dolphins with DC Terrell Williams absent.
Head coach Mike Vrabel expressed confidence in Kuhr, citing his preparation and prior experience in similar roles.
Kuhr's coaching background includes roles at Ohio State, James Madison, Rutgers, and Texas State, before joining the Patriots.

title: Boston activist Monica Cannon-Grant to plead guilty in federal fraud case
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Monica Cannon-Grant plans to plead guilty in federal fraud case before her trial on October 14.
Prosecutors allege Cannon-Grant and her late husband defrauded donors to their nonprofit, Violence in Boston.
She faces charges including conspiracy, wire fraud, and making false statements, risking decades in prison.
